intro: Neoporteria subgibbosa f. tunensis, commonly known as the Tunisian form of the species, is a rare and distinctive plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its unique leaf morphology and flowering habits. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, displaying a range of colors from pink to purple. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
